div.head: For making varnish
div.ab: Take some mastic, sang daRage darac, gum arabic & spike lavender oil, as much of one as the other, & make them melt all together, & before coating it, lay a coat of glue quite clear, & let it dry.

div.head: Antidote against the smoke of metals
div.ab: In the morning, take a piece of thin toast with butter, neither antimony nor any other vapors will harm you. Or put half a pig's bladder in front of your face.

div.head: Tin for casting
div.ab: They use common tin, which is the one that pewterers use to make dishes, which is composed of 9 or ten ten lb of fine lead for one quintal of tin.
left-bottomSome find that there is nothing better than fine tin.

div.head: Mixture for printers
div.ab: Apply a coat of antimony, and pulverize on a coat of latten, old metal scrapings, or thin plates of iron or the iron nail heads, and continue in this way until the crucible is full.
